title: SpaceX launches 25th Dragon resupply mission to space station
summary: SpaceX launched a Dragon cargo ship toward the International Space Station in a fiery twilight departure from NASA’s Kennedy Space Center, hauling a $118 million climate instrument, fresh food, experiments, and supplies for the lab’s seven-person crew.

title: NASA Administrator, Deputy to Attend Farnborough Airshow
summary: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson and Deputy Administrator Pam Melroy will attend the Farnborough International Airshow in the United Kingdom on Monday, July 18.

title: Elon Musk: “Tesla is to protect life on Earth”
summary: Earlier today, Tesla & SpaceX CEO Elon Musk tweeted “Tesla is to protect life on Earth, SpaceX to extend life beyond.” If...

title: Rogozin removed as head of Roscosmos as seat barter agreement signed
summary: The Russian government dismissed Dmitry Rogozin as the head of the space agency Roscosmos July 15, the same day the agency and NASA signed a long-anticipated agreement to exchange seats on flights to the International Space Station.

title: We want to hear from you
summary: SpaceNews is conducting a reader survey to learn more about our audience and your expectations.

title: Registration Now Open for NASA 2022 International Space Apps Challenge
summary: The NASA International Space Apps Challenge – the world’s largest annual hackathon – returns this year with the theme “Make Space,” which emphasizes NASA’s commitment to inclusivity.

title: The trampoline is now international: NASA and Roscosmos agree to seat swap
summary: No funds will be exchanged as part of the agreement.

title: Dmitry Rogozin has been dismissed as director general of Roscosmos [Updated]
summary: A thorn in NASA's side is gone. Will the next guy be any better?

title: Virgin Galactic selects Arizona for spaceplane manufacturing facility
summary: Virgin Galactic announced July 14 plans to assemble a fleet of suborbital spaceplanes in a new factory in a suburb of Phoenix.

title: Rocket Report: Vega-C is a sight to see; will Europe push SpaceX aside?
summary: "I am delighted to see solid progress towards first flight."
